Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_filter_DLS_with_XMI

The function AIL_filter_DLS_with_XMI filters out unused instruments in a DLS file given one or more XMIDI files.

S32 AIL_filter_DLS_with_XMI(
  void const * XMI,
  void const * dls,
  void * *filtereddls,
  U32 *dlssize,
  S32 flags,
  AILLENGTHYCB callback
);

In Parameters

XMI
should point to a loaded XMIDI file image.
dls
should point to a loaded DLS or MLS file image.
flags
is zero, or one or more of the MILES_FILTER_DLS_FLAGS.
callback
should be set to the address of the callback function which is invoked at several stages of the filtering process. See AILLENGTHYCB for a description of this callback.

Out Parameters

filtereddls
should be the address of a " void* " pointer that will return with the pointer to the new filtered DLS file image. This parameter can be NULL if you don't need it.
dlssize
should be the address of an unsigned 32-bit integer that will return with the size of the new filtered DLS file image. This parameter can be NULL if you don't need it.

Returns

1, if the call was successful, or 0 if the call failed.

Discussion

You must free the pointer returned in filtereddls with AIL_mem_free_lock.

Depending on the complexity of the XMIDI and DLS files, this function can take several minutes to return.


Group: Utility Services
Related Functions: AILLENGTHYCB, AIL_extract_DLS, AIL_find_DLS, AIL_mem_free_lock
Related Basic Types: MILES_FILTER_DLS_FLAGS, S32, U32, void *, void const *
